info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 7:57PM EDT until August 12 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...OHIO AND BROOKE COUNTIES... At 757 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Wolfdale, or 7 miles south of Avella, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Washington, Canonsburg, Valley Grove, Wolfdale, McGovern, East Washington, Houston, Claysville, Eighty Four, West Alexander, Taylorstown, West Middletown, Amity, Green Hills, and Meadow Lands. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
